title.narrative: Presession of the Permanent Forum for Indigenous Issues in Inari and UN regional consultation on enhanced participation 9.-18.2.2020

description.narrative: The topic of of the UN Permanent Forum for Indigenous Issues deals with peace and security and is related to implementing the SDG16 Peace Justice and Strong Institutions. The PFII will be held in New York in April 2020. The pression which is organized in I nari will gather all the 16 members of the Forum nine of which come from ODA eligible countries as well UN secretariat members. In addition a training session on peace and reconciliation will be organized as well as a regional consultation on enhancing the participation of indigenous peoples in connection with the presession. The implementation of organizational matters related to both meetings will be taken care by the Helsinki Deaconess Institute in coperation with Anne Nuorgam chair of the Forum and loca l indigenous organizations. Enhancing the economic and social development is in line with the Finnish development policy and the priorities of Finland's international human rights policy. The project will support the UN in enhancing the rights of indigenou s peoples and developing peaceful and stable societies taking into account climate change. The projecy is funded by Finnish development cooperation funding with a sum of 95 000 euros in order to cover the travel expenses of the attendees from developing co untries.
